taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Panicum capillare subsp. hillmanii (Chase) Freckmann & Lelong

bio:treatment.description: Culms often stout and stiff, usually bluish-green, usually not branching at the base. Blades thick, firm. Panicle branches stiff; secondary branches and pedicels usually appressed, varying to narrowly divergent. Spikelets 2.2-3 mm. Lower paleas 1-1.8 mm; mature upper florets nigrescent, with a prominent lunate scar at the base.
bio:treatment.discussion: Panicum capillare subsp. hillmanii grows in weedy habitats in California, New Mexico, Iowa, Kansas, Oklahoma, and Texas.
